revised_title: Investigating the Resistance of Air to the Motion of Elongated Projectiles with Variously Formed Heads
tldr: The author, F. Bashforth, investigates the resistance of air to elongated projectiles with variously formed heads, finding that the resistance increases as the cube of the velocity. He develops a chronograph to measure the time occupied by a projectile in passing over successive equal spaces, providing a more accurate method for determining air resistance.
